articles.title: Secy. Kim Jong Il's celebrated work published in India
articles.content:
Secy. Kim Jong Il's celebrated work published in India

   Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- "Respecting the 
forerunners of the revolution is a noble moral obligation of 
revolutionaries", a celebrated work of the great leader 
comrade Kim Jong Il, was published in pamphlet by the 
everest publishing house of india January 1 on the occasion 
of the new year. The pamphlet reads in the preface:
   The great leader, his excellency Kim Jong Il, though he 
was busy with leading the revolution and construction, 
authored a number of celebrated works, which give all-
round answers to many complicated questions raised by the 
times, thereby lighting the road ahead of the Korean and the 
world's revolution.
   For their originality and profoundness, his works have 
totally gripped the people's hearts, boundlessly 
encouraging their struggle for justice, peace and socialism.

articles.title: Secy. Kim Jong Il's 55th birthday to be celebrated in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Comrade Kim Jong Il's 55th birthday to be celebrated in Bangladesh
   Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- The Bangladeshi national 
committee for celebrating the 55th birthday of the great 
leader comrade Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in Dhaka on 
December 24, 1996.
   The committee has rashed Khan Menon, general secretary of 
the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, as its chairman, Nuran 
Nabie, secretary general of the Bangladesh-Korea friendship 
association, as its secretary general and 21 political and 
public figures including general secretaries of eight other 
political parties as its members.
   Elaborating on the program for celebrations, the 
nuran nabie said in his speech that, through the 
celebrations, they would broadly explain and propagandize 
the greatness of comrade Kim Jong Il among the Bangladeshi 
people and deeply inform them of the invincibility of the 
Korean-style socialism.

articles.title: Struggle of s. Korean workers will continue
articles.content:
Struggle of S. Korean workers will continue
   Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- The second-stage 
indefinite general strike of South Korean workers against 
the revised "Labour law" is an eruption of their pent-up 
wrath and resentment against the anti-social policy of the 
kim Young Sam group, declared Minju joson in a signed 
commentary January 5.
   Recalling that the Kim Young Sam group, who had refused 
to withdraw any of "labour-related laws", went the length of 
announcing them in an "official gazette" on December 31, the 
news analyst of the paper says:
   This outrageous act is a frontal challenge to the demands 
of workers.
   It is only too natural that the South Korean workers have 
started the second-stage indefinite general strike. It is 
because their struggle is a very righteous one to win their 
vital rights and democracy.
   They will not abandon their struggle till their demands 
are met but they will continue their valiant struggle for 
the independence and democracy of South Korean society and 
national reunification.

articles.title: Italian pays homage to Pres. Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Italian pays homage to Pres. Kim Il Sung 
   Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- Giancarlo Elia Valori, 
secretary general of the Italian Institute of 
International Relations, Sunday visited the Kumsusan 
Memorial Palace in which the great leader 
President Kim Il Sung is preserved in state.
   He paid tribute to the statue of the great leader and 
made a bow before him.
   He looked round with keen interest the relics the 
president used in his lifetime.
   He wrote in the visitor's book that the palace where 
president Kim Il Sung received him and his mother several 
times is an unforgettable place and that the president is 
immortal.

articles.title: Struggle for nullifying amended labour laws continues in s. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle for nullifying amended labour laws continues in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- The struggle of the people 
from all walks of life in South Korea is continuing in the 
new year, too, to protest the revised "labour laws", Seoul-
based radio reports said.
   The "Federation of Korea Trade Unions" on January 5 held 
rallies for nullifying the amended "Labour laws" in seven 
major areas of South Korea including Seoul, Pusan, Taejon 
and Inchon, and demanded the abolition of the "laws".
   The federation in a declaration of struggle published at 
a rally in front of Seoul railway station said that "The 
system of flexible work hours", which is included in the 
"Labour laws", means the transfer of the right to decide 
work hours to the employer and that the "System of 
readjustment and laying off" means a sentence of death on 
workers. It declared it would call a general strike in case 
they are not withdrawn.
   At rallies the federation strongly urged the "New Korea 
Party" to immediately renounce the "labour laws" which 
threaten the workers' right to existence, and apologize to 
the people.
   The all-people measure committee for defending democracy 
held a rally for nullifying the "laws on labour affairs and 
the agency for national security planning" at the Jongmyo 
park in Seoul and said that it will turn out in the struggle 
against the regime in case these evil laws are not 
abolished.
   On jan. 4, the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions 
and the National Roman Catholic Priests' Group for the 
Realisation of Justice held rallies to protest the 
railroaded amendment bills on labour affairs and the "ANSP" 
at myongdong cathedral in Seoul.
   On January 1, members of the lawyers for democratic 
society staged a sit-in. 
   The confederation declared that more than 200 trade 
unions under its affiliation including the federation of 
trade unions for hyundai group subsidiaries and the 
federation of office clerks' unions will go on a strike from 
January 6 and the federation of trade unions of hospitals 
and trade unions of broadcasting corporations will join it 
from January 7.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun calls for stepping up New Year's march with confidence, optimism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun calls for stepping up New Year's march with confidence, optimism
   Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today 
editorially calls on the officials, party members and all 
other working people to take part in the new year's 
worthwhile general onward movement with revolutionary 
confidence and optimism and make this a year of new 
prosperity and victory, a significant year which effects a 
turn in the Korean revolution.
   Continuing advance and innovation for fresh victory with 
revolutionary confidence and optimism is the Korean people's 
noble traits and traditional characteristics, the daily 
says, adding:
   We must launch a final campaign to finish the "Arduous 
March" victoriously under the red flag.
   Guided by the respected general Kim Jong Il, the Korean 
people are in high spirits, sure of the victory in this 
year's march. They have an iron will and grit given by the 
powerful party and the leader and their strength is strong 
enough to successfully make this year's march.
   If all the people are to speed up this year's march with 
revolutionary confidence and optimism, they should be deeply 
aware of the greatness of general Kim Jong Il.
   Confidence in the victorious revolution is, so to speak, 
the conviction of the leader's greatness.
   Our revolution is guided by the great leader comrade
Kim Jong Il. We should start this year's march with the 
belief that we can overcome whatever difficulties and carry 
out whatever tasks because we enjoy his wise leadership.
   For a successful march this year, it is also important 
that all the people fully display the revolutionary spirit 
of braving all the hardships.
   General Kim Jong Il, on the basis of a scientific 
analysis of the present situation and the nation's economic 
conditions, has clearly indicated a way of making a 
considerable progress in socialist construction this year.
   The party members and all other working people should 
courageously overcome all the difficulties with the might of 
singlehearted unity and revolutionary comradeship which have 
been brought into full play in the country, a large family 
with him as the father.
   It is the resolution and will of the Korean people to 
successfully carry out this year's tasks set forth by the 
party and fully demonstrate the spirit of socialist Korea 
once again.

articles.title: Pyongyangites vow to implement tasks set out in joint New Year editorial
articles.content:
Pyongyangites vow to implement tasks set out in joint New Year editorial
   Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang mass meeting 
was held at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on January 5 to 
carry through the militant tasks laid down in the joint 
editorial of the organs of the party, the army and the youth 
published on the occasion of the new year.
   Present on the occasion were vice-president Pak Song Chol 
and secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea central 
committee Han Song Ryong, who are members of the political 
bureau of the WPK central committee, and other officials as 
well as working people from all social standings.
   The reporter and speakers said that the joint editorial, 
which summed up the brilliant achievements made last year 
and brightly indicated targets and tasks for the new year 
and ways to put them into practice, is a banner of victory 
which powerfully encourages the whole party, the entire 
people and the whole army to a general march forward to 
exalt the Korean-style socialism.
   What is important in stepping up the general advance this 
year is to dye the whole society in the idea of the red flag 
of the Workers' Party of Korea, they noted.
   They said that this year's major tasks for socialist 
economic construction are to decisively solve the food 
problem and drastically improve the living standard of the 
people by making the maximum use of the already-laid 
economic foundation under the motto of self-reliance and lay 
a solid basis for the prosperity of the country through the 
acceleration of land administration.
   In order to triumphantly hasten the general advance this 
year, they added, it is very important to build up the 
defence capabilities of the country as much as possible.
   They called for frustrating the aggressive moves of the 
enemy and pushing ahead with socialist construction with the 
might of singlehearted unity of the army and people by fully 
displaying the tradition of this unity.
   The key to the successful implementation of the vast 
tasks  for socialist construction is to give full scope to 
the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance, the Collectivist 
mode of life and the revolutionary traits of personal 
examples, they stressed.   
   They called for making a great upsurge in production and 
construction.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun calls for nationwide efforts for reunification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun calls for nationwide efforts for reunification
   Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- As the newspapers of the 
party, the army and the youth made clear in the new year 
joint editorial, the three principles of national 
reunification, the proposal for founding the democratic 
confederal republic of koryo and the ten-point programme of 
the great unity of the whole nation, which were put forward 
by the great leader comrade Kim Il Sung, are three mainstays 
and three charters the Korean nation should invariably 
maintain for the country's reunification.
   Rodong Sinmun says this in an article today.
   All the Koreans in the north, south and overseas should 
join in the efforts for the independence and peaceful 
reunification of the nation in line with the ten-point 
programme, the article says. They should make a tangible 
contribution to promoting the great unity and reunification 
of the nation, those with strength dedicating their 
strength, those with knowledge giving their knowledge and 
those with money donating their money.
   The article further says:
   Most of the compatriots in the north, south and overseas 
love the fatherland and value the sovereignty of the nation 
as its members, putting the common interests of the nation 
above anything else, irrespective of their living 
conditions, ideologies, political view, religious belief, 
knowledge and property.
   If the workers, peasants, youth, students, intellectuals, 
believers, national capitalists of conscience and all other 
Koreans who hope for the country's reunification 
collaborate, support and cooperate with each other in an 
integral way and take a joint action, making the best of 
their characteristics, they can constitute a powerful 
driving force of reunification and successfully accomplish 
the cause.
   All the compatriots should faithfully uphold the 
respected comrade Kim Jong Il as the leader of the nation 
and take part in the patriotic movement for implementing the 
policies and proposals advanced by the fatherly leader 
comrade Kim Il Sung and general Kim Jong Il for the 
reunification of the country, the nation's desire.
